alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 5:07AM CDT until March 26 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Maries River near Westphalia. Meramec River near Sullivan. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Big River at Byrnesville. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.1 feet, The north end of County Road 521 begins flooding adjacent to the river near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:32 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:32 AM CDT Friday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Maries River Westphalia 10.0 10.3 6.3 4.1 3.0 2.5 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
